meanings.definition: To take the place of (someone or something) in authority, standing, or importance
meanings.sent1: The new manager superceded the old one in leading the team.
meanings.sent2: The fresh ideas superceded the traditional methods in the company.
meanings.sent3: The young student superceded the teacher in solving the math problem.
meanings.sent4: The rising star superceded the veteran actor in popularity.
meanings.sent5: The bright sun superceded the dark clouds, bringing light to the sky.

meanings.definition: To replace (something old or outdated) with something new or better
meanings.sent1: The modern technology superceded the old machinery in the factory.
meanings.sent2: The new model superceded the outdated one in the market.
meanings.sent3: The fresh paint superceded the faded color on the walls.
meanings.sent4: The young athlete superceded the retired player in skill.
meanings.sent5: The blooming flowers superceded the withered ones, adding color to the garden.
